sentences.en: A throw of the dice allows a player to move himself forward.
sentences.cn: 掷一次骰子,玩家可相应向前移动.

sentences.en: All her attempts to find a better job were unsuccessful; It'seemed that the dice were loaded against her.
sentences.cn: 她想找个好点的工作,可一切的努力都没成功. 她总是不顺利.

sentences.en: Bill wanted to let Bob join the team, but I said that was no dice because Bob was too young.
sentences.cn: 比尔想让鲍勃参加球队, 但我没同意,因为鲍勃年龄太小.
将甜菜根切成整齐的小方块.

sentences.en: He asked for more money but she said no dice to him.
sentences.cn: 他要求多给点钱,她对他说不行.

sentences.en: He enticed his former employer into another dice game.
sentences.cn: 他挑逗他原来的老板再赌一次掷骰子.

sentences.en: I sat down and saw the box and dice go round apace.
sentences.cn: 我坐下看骰子在盘子里迅速地转动着.

sentences.en: It's your throw, eg your turn to throw the dice.
sentences.cn: 该你掷了(如该你掷色子).

sentences.en: Kicked on that occasion for cheating at dice?
Peel, stone and dice the mango.

words.tran_cn: 帽子，小礼帽；玩掷骰子游戏的人

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式，主北美)不行；没门（用于拒绝请求或表示不可能做到）
使用欺诈手段,暗中搞鬼[亦作play with marked cards]

trans.tran_en: a small block of wood, plastic etc that has six sides with a different number of spots on each side, used in games
to cut food into small square pieces
